intro: Cathormion leptophyllum subsp. guineense, commonly known as the Guinea cathormion, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
